com.lambdaworks.redis

Interface RedisChannelWriter<K,V>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - Key type.
    V - Value type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CommandHandler, PubSubCommandHandler

    public interface RedisChannelWriter<K,V>
extends Closeable
    Writer for a channel. Writers push commands on to the communication channel and maintain a state for the commands.
    Since:
    3.0
    Author:
    Mark Paluch

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close() 
      void flushCommands()
      Flush pending commands.
      void reset()
      Reset the writer state.
      void setAutoFlushCommands(boolean autoFlush)
      Disable or enable auto-flush behavior.
      void setRedisChannelHandler(RedisChannelHandler<K,V> redisChannelHandler)
      Set the corresponding connection instance in order to notify it about channel active/inactive state.
      <T,C extends RedisCommand<K,V,T>>
      C      		 write(C command)
      Write a command on the channel.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        <T,C extends RedisCommand<K,V,T>> C write(C command)
        Write a command on the channel. The command may be changed/wrapped during write and the written instance is returned after the call.
        Type Parameters:
        T - result type
        C - command type
        Parameters:
        command - the redis command
        Returns:
        the written redis command

      • close

        void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reset the writer state. Queued commands will be canceled and the internal state will be reset. This is useful when the internal state machine gets out of sync with the connection.

      • setRedisChannelHandler

        void setRedisChannelHandler(RedisChannelHandler<K,V> redisChannelHandler)
        Set the corresponding connection instance in order to notify it about channel active/inactive state.
        Parameters:
        redisChannelHandler - the channel handler (external connection object)

      • setAutoFlushCommands

        void setAutoFlushCommands(boolean autoFlush)
        Disable or enable auto-flush behavior. Default is true. If autoFlushCommands is disabled, multiple commands can be issued without writing them actually to the transport. Commands are buffered until a flushCommands() is issued. After calling flushCommands() commands are sent to the transport and executed by Redis.
        Parameters:
        autoFlush - state of autoFlush.

      • flushCommands

        void flushCommands()
        Flush pending commands. This commands forces a flush on the channel and can be used to buffer ("pipeline") commands to achieve batching. No-op if channel is not connected.
